statement:
If the points $X$, $Y$ and $Z$ are on the sides of a triangle $ABC$
(including their prolongations), collinear and do not coincide with any
of the points $A$, $B$ and $C$, then the equation
$$\frac{AZ}{ZB}\cdot\frac{BY}{YC}\cdot\frac{CX}{XA} = -1$$ holds (all
segments are directed line segments). The converse of this theorem also
holds (thus: three points on the prolongations of the triangle’s sides
are collinear if the above equation holds).
